description:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience within compensation.
  • Experience with spreadsheet software.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with analyzing, validating and developing business process requirements.
  • Experience with analyzing data and presenting trends to peers and managers, highlighting data patterns that could be useful for making business decisions.
  • Experience working at a consulting firm or working on large-scale project and with multiple stakeholders.
  • Experience with compensation delivery and HR domain.
  • Advanced spreadsheet and process documentation skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, be diplomatic and influence stakeholders, vendors and international teams.
responsibilities:
• Become a subject matter expert in compensation related HR processes, using this knowledge and data to introduce process efficiencies and improvements, analyze data to identify trends and make informed decisions to drive continuous improvement.
  • Generate compensation offers for Google candidates and role-transfers.
  • Develop data-driven solutions focused on improving both operational efficiencies and employee experience, identifying both short and long term opportunities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders to develop seamless operational processes to support Google's People Operation policies. This will include collaborating with teams virtually cross region and location.
  • Create and maintain process documentation for all your processes and provide training to your colleagues where required.
title: Operations Analyst (Compensation), People Operations
